hints.content:
The first bar lines up to $\redD{9}$.   


[[☃ image 1]]

The aquarium has $\redD{9}$ of which animal?

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Animal and the vertical axis labeled Number at aquarium. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: question mark, question mark, question mark, and question mark. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, and 30. The bar line for each Animal shows the following: first question mark bar line extends to 9, second question mark bar line extends to 18, third question mark bar line extends to 12, and fourth question mark bar line extends to 27.  A red line is drawn to the right from 9, which reaches to the end of the first question mark bar line. !

hints.content:
Animal  | Number at the aquarium 
:- | :-: 
Otters | $\redC9$ 

The aquarium has $\redC{9}$ otters.  So, the first bar should be labeled $\redC{\text{Otters}}$.

Now let's label the other bars.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Animal and the vertical axis labeled Number at aquarium. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Otters, Seahorses, Eels, and Turtles. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, and 30. The bar line for each Animal shows the following: Otters bar line extends to 9, Seahorses bar line extends to 18, Eels bar line extends to 12, and Turtles bar line extends to 27. !

question.content:
Alexandra created a chart and a bar graph to show how many of each type of animal she saw at the aquarium today.

Animal  | Number at the aquarium 
:- | :-: 
Turtles | $27$ 
Seahorses | $18$ 
Otters | $9$ 
Eels | $12$ 

**Label each bar on the bar graph.**

[[☃ label-image 1]]

options.imageAlt: A table shows the type of animal and the number of of them that are in the aquarium. There are twenty seven turtles. There are eighteen sea hosrses. There are nine otters and twelve eels.
